data: {"page":1,"results":[{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/7f6OExJlPDYf5UPTjtIOCythZun.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":1180493,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Complete Story of Film","overview":"At 18 hours and 43 minutes long, 'The Complete Story of Film' collects two epic documentaries by Mark Cousins into a stunningly expansive global journey through film history from the birth of cinema to today. The Story of Film: An Odyssey is an inclusive and ground-breaking journey through the history of world cinema and a treat for movie lovers around the globe. Guided by filmmaker and historian Mark Cousins, this wonderfully insightful 15-hour love letter to the movies begins with the invention of motion pictures at the end of the 19th century, continuing through the entire 20th century of moviemaking and concluding with the globalized digital industry of the 21st. In The Story of Film: A New Generation, Cousins picks up where Odyssey left off, returning with a new epic and hopeful tale of modern cinematic innovation in the new millennium, exploring how movies and moviegoing have evolved and will continue to transform to our collective joy and wonder.","popularity":1.845,"poster_path":"/bJw6vLP9KsSeO3W8iYPNurO3bLu.jpg","release_date":"2023-08-29","title":"The Complete Story of Film","video":false,"vote_average":8.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":399632,"original_language":"fr","original_title":"La grande évasion : Ile de La Réunion","overview":"Divers, mountain guides, paragliders or even base jumpers share their love of extreme sensations.","popularity":0.374,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2014-01-01","title":"La grande évasion : Ile de La Réunion","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/uawEBM7SlvXnbeuNxokLZGzWlIn.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":713500,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Dear Class of 2020","overview":"A virtual commencement celebration bringing together inspirational leaders, celebrities, and YouTube creators to celebrate graduates, their families, and their communities. Upon a Time in  Sarajevo","overview":"Can three comedians from Bosnia overcome the bitterness of the past to reunite and reconcile? Often compared to Monty Python's Flying Circus the comedy team from Sarajevo known as Top Lista Nadrealista or The Surrealist Hit Parade rose to prominence on the eve of the breakup of Yugoslavia. Nele, Zenit and Djuro became household names throughout the Balkans. The wars that followed the splintering of the country pitted each of the diverse communities against one another. The bitter conflict exposed some nationalist loyalties among the comedians and lead to the acrimonious break-up of Top Lista. The split reflecting the broader tribulations dividing their homeland.","popularity":0.955,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2014-12-11","title":"Once Upon a Time in  Sarajevo","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/qUgUPtEJc3RHbhcomK1aP8vyXN6.jpg","genre_ids":[99],"id":1180667,"original_language":"cs","original_title":"Kouzelný kopec","overview":"Documentary about Barrandov studios.","popularity":0.802,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2023-09-09","title":"Kouzelný kopec","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/kJoxU6OF4SBACVUES8one1QfnNR.jpg","genre_ids":[99,10402],"id":230864,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Marvin Hamlisch: What He Did For Love","overview":"When Marvin Hamlisch passed away in August 2012 the worlds of music, theatre and cinema lost a talent the likes of which we may never see again. Seemingly destined for greatness, Hamlisch was accepted into New York’s Juilliard School as a 6-year-old musical prodigy and rapidly developed into a phenomenon. With instantly classic hits ‘The Way We Were’ and ‘Nobody Does It Better’ and scores for Hollywood films such as The Swimmer, The Sting and Sophie’s Choice and the Broadway juggernaut A Chorus Line; Hamlisch became the go-to composer for film and Broadway producers and a prominent presence on the international Concert Hall circuit. His streak was staggering, vast, unprecedented and glorious, by the age of 31 Hamlisch had won 4 Grammys, an Emmy, 3 Oscars, a Tony and a Pulitzer prize: success that burned so bright, it proved impossible to match.","popularity":5.176,"poster_path":"/sW5KNObsL9xFPQEuuSPqNvIAsI.jpg","release_date":"2013-10-12","title":"Marvin Hamlisch: What He Did For Astroturf","video":false,"vote_average":9.0,"vote_count":2},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":736349,"original_language":"bg","original_title":"Бинка: Да разкажеш приказка за мълчанието","overview":"A film pioneer, Binka Zhelyazkova was at the forefront of political cinema under Bulgaria's Communist dictatorship. Though she remained faithful to the communist ideals she became an avid critic of the regime and brought upon herself the wrath of its censorship. As a result four of her nine films were shelved and released to the public only after the fall of the regime in 1989, and Binka Zhelyazkova became known as the bad girl of Bulgarian cinema. A provocative portrait that reveals the pressures and complexities that arise when art is made under totalitarianism.","popularity":1.277,"poster_path":"/ztilhByHcBIzWSos13VBFXXI6jG.jpg","release_date":"2007-01-01","title":"Binka: To Tell a Story About Silence","video":false,"vote_average":9.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/kyIMvZQiHqZpzcw5jSI2AIti6zI.jpg","genre_ids":[99,35],"id":40819,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Best Worst Movie","overview":"A look at the making of the film Troll 2 (1990) and its journey from being crowned the \"worst film of all time\" to a cherished cult classic.","popularity":6.023,"poster_path":"/4LQ6kdvVJW9y0B9O4qDTsazNzER.jpg","release_date":"2009-03-14","title":"Best Worst Movie","video":false,"vote_average":7.1,"vote_count":164},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":1212601,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Silent Echoes: Seven Chances","overview":"In this visual essay John Bengtson, author of Silent Echoes: Discovering Early Hollywood Through the Films of Buster Keaton, provides a tour of where Seven Chances was filmed, comparing archival images with contemporary photos, and sharing stories of Mrs. Eleanor Keaton's visit to the Seven Chances church.","popularity":0.491,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2011-12-13","title":"Silent Echoes: Seven Chances","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[99],"id":1212602,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Silent Echoes","overview":"Four visual essays by Silent Echoes author John Bengtson identifying Buster Keaton's shooting locations for his many short films produced between 1920-1923, many in the streets surrounding his former Hollywood studio, the same studio where, a few years earlier, Charlie Chaplin had made his brilliant series of Mutual shorts.
